alert.note: Alert for Ferry (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 18 at 10:27AM PDT until May 25 at 7:00AM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew affecting Ferry County. Stehekin River at Stehekin affecting Chelan County. .Warm temperatures this weekend will melt high mountain snowpack and result in increased river flows. Minor flooding is forecast to continue for the next several days for both rivers. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew. * WHEN...Until Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Flooding at Beal Park on West Kettle River Road, west of Curlew. `Ol Swimming Hole Park in Curlew will be inundated. Flooding of yards and outbuildings along the river from the Canadian border through Curlew on both sides of the river. Some driveways on Kettle River Road will be flooded. Water will be over Customs Road near Riverview Lane and between milepost 5 and 6. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM PDT Thursday the stage was 18.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 17.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 18.9 feet Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 18.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.7 feet on 05/20/2008. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Cold and swift flowing rivers can be life threatening this time of year. The combination of cold water shock and fast current increases the danger of drowning in our rivers. Keep an eye on children if they are playing near rivers and put a life jacket on them. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by late Thursday evening.this evening at 1100 PM PDT.
